newsitem.title: INDONESIA: Indonesian rupiah strong on band speculation.
newsitem.headline: Indonesian rupiah strong on band speculation.

text.p: The Indonesian rupiah was well bid against the dollar in volatile late Friday trading on sustained speculation of a band widening, dealers said.
They said spot dollar managed to rebound to 2,362.90/63.00 at 0900 GMT after falling three points below the central bank intervention band at midday. It opened at 2,363.0/64.0.
A local bank dealer said the dollar recovered after players were confident that band rumours were unfounded for now.
The central bank kept its intervention band unchanged at 2,363/2,555 and the conversion band at 2,363/2,411 on Friday.
"The market is calmer now although the rate is still trading slightly off the band," the dealer said.
Dealers said the central bank was believed to have absorbed plenty of dollars on Friday during the squaring time, driving operators to sell swaps across the board immediately.
One foreign bank dealer said operators believed liquidity would be pretty ample on Tuesday which would depress swaps.
He said some even assumed money from dollars buying would also come in on Monday because of some buying on Thursday.
"So people seemed to anticipate an ample week," he said.
Tomorrow and today rupiah closed at 2,362.00/62.75 and 2,361.35/61.50, respectively. Overnight swap was at 1.5/1.6 and tom/next was last given at 2.3/3.3 points.
Dealers in Jakarta said they did not believe the central bank would bow to market pressure to widen the band.
One well-placed economist said the central bank governor had explicitly said this week the rupiah exchange rate will be maintained at a realistic level without anti-export bias.
He said this meant the central bank would maintain its band at present because a widening would appreciate the rupiah.
One-month swap declined to 11.0/12.0 from 12.75/13.50, two to 22.5/23.25 from 23.75/24.50, three to 34.0/35.0 from 37.25/37.50 and six to 74.0/75.0 from 75.5/76.5 points.
